column1: Insert Full Caption/ Take Home Message Here

Higher socioeconomic status is associated with lower smoking prevalence not only in high- but also in low- and middle-income countries. The relationship between socioeconomic status and the intensity of smoking (number of cigarettes consumed per day by current smokers) is not obvious and the pattern differs from country to country.
